pros: Great organization to work for. If you love to help others, here is the place to be. Benefits, retirement plan, career advancement.
cons: As it is a not-for-profit, the salary is not that high when compared to private organizations.

review_title: Nothing more than a stepping stone
job_title: Child and Youth Worker in Cambridge, ON
pros: if you find a good group of co-workers it is fun, clients you serve are often very nice and grateful
cons: bad management not fair pay for the amount of work you do long hours gossip amongst staff

job_title: Housing Support Worker in Kitchener, ON
pros: Day shifts, holidays off, weekends off. The work we do with clients is fullfilling
cons: No overtime. Sometimes the work can be draining due to the nature of the job.

review_title: Do very good community work especially with newcomers
pros: Community good work Not overly stressful

Great CEO
Rewarding work
Flexible employer
Supportive, knowledgeable colleagues
cons:
Organization branding/promotion can be confusing for clients, many programs in different cities
Turnover of leadership in programs can be high, new supervisors and managers do not seem to receive adequate training, scramble to figure things out
Work / life balance can be an issue due to staffing shortages

job_title: Child and Youth Counsellor in Kitchener, ON
pros: The pay is pretty good compared to its competitors and management cares about employees safety.

Benefits are great!
Great working hours
Flexibility
Work from home
cons: Management is at times not reliable.

job_title: Child and Youth Counsellor in Waterloo, ON
pros: A great organization that allows people the opportunity to work hands on with youth facing mental health. The front line staff are, for the most part, caring, easy to get along with, and reliant.
cons: Positions that are usually offered now, are mostly contracted, which is unfortunate for people looking for full time or permanent work. You have to really fight and prove yourself in order to move up (which is fair). Management will sometimes use overly-validating tone of voice which makes it difficult for solution-based conversations.

pros: Truly a caring, encouraging and supportive team. Leaderships values and understands personal and professional goals and support you in reaching them. Fantastic company culture and local teams.
cons: Competitive to obtain a FT position as most staff stay at Lutherwood long term. Compensation rate is typical of not for profit work.
Pay is low and benefits are poor

cons:

pros:
